business.headline: HAL, IRFC, BHEL stocks fall: Here's why PSU stocks are under pressurePSU stocks fell even as India's benchmark indices, Sensex and Nifty, rose on the back of higher-than-expected interest rate cuts by the US Federal Reserve.

Explained: What US Fed's 50 bps rate cut means for Indian economyThe Fed's decision signalled a shift towards easing monetary policy, with experts divided on its implications for the global economy, including India. Here's a detailed look at how the bigger-than-expected rate cut could impact the Indian economy and the broader market.
Cisco cuts thousands of jobs in second biggest layoff of 2024: Report This latest round of layoffs follows a previous cut in February when Cisco let go of about 4,000 employees.

US Fed cuts rates by 50 bps: How will it affect Indian stock market?This is the first time the Fed has reduced rates since 2020, and it has been done to address slowing economic growth and easing inflation in the US.

Sensex jumps over 700 points, Nifty crosses 25,500 for 1st time; IT stocks gainThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 758.7 points at 83,706.93 at 9:41 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 215.40 points to trade at 25,592.95.

US Fed slashes rates by 50 bps in first rate reduction since 2020Policymakers see the Fed's benchmark rate falling by another half of a percentage point by the end of this year, another full percentage point in 2025, and by a final half of a percentage point in 2026 to end in a 2.75 per cent-3.00 per cent range.
US Fed rate decision today at 11:30 pm – 5 things to watch outMarkets are widely expecting a 25-basis-point cut in the key interest rate, marking the first reduction in four years.

Tupperware, once a household name, files for bankruptcyTupperware Brands and some of its subsidiaries filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection on Tuesday. The company, widely known for its food storage containers, has been struggling with falling sales in recent years.

NPS Vatsalya: How to invest, eligibility criteria, and online buying guideNPS Vatsalya enables parents or guardians to open a pension account for minors and contribute as little as Rs 1,000 annually, making it accessible to families from various economic backgrounds.

Explained: Why IT stocks faced profit booking ahead of US Fed rate decisionMphasiS led the decline, dropping 5.6%, followed by L&T Technology Services, Persistent Systems, Tata Consultancy Services, HCL Technologies, and Tech Mahindra, which saw losses ranging from 3% to 4%.
Sensex, Nifty fall amid profit booking in IT stocks; TCS falls 4%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 131.43 points down at 82,948.23, whille the NSE Nifty50 lost 41 points to end at 25,377.55.

Reliance Infra shares hit 20% upper circuit. What's next? The sharp uptick in Reliance Infra's share price followed the company's announcement of a significant reduction in its standalone external debt, from Rs 3,831 crore to Rs 475 crore.
Paytm shares cross Rs 700 for the first time since January. More room to rise?	Before today, the last time Paytm traded above Rs 700 was in late January, closing at Rs 761.

Radhika Gupta calls SIPs the new status symbol for Delhi's young investorsRadhika Gupta, MD and CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, believes that the true indicator of success in today's financial landscape should be how much one invests in Systematic Investment Plans (SIPs), not the number of real estate holdings.

Government assures no price hikes for essential commodities this festive seasonThe Ministry of Food and Consumer Affairs has highlighted that, as of now, there are no plans to allow any increase in prices for essentials items.
Bajaj Housing Finance shares dip after multibagger rally: Buy, hold, or sell?After a stellar market debut, Bajaj Housing Finance shares have dipped today—should investors be concerned or hold steady?

How West Bengal lost its crown as India's financial hubFrom economic powerhouse to struggling state, West Bengal's fall from its prime spot in India's financial scene tells a story of lost opportunity and shifting fortunes.

Infosys, TCS, Wipro: Key stocks to watch as US Fed gets ready to cut ratesHistorically, a Fed rate cut cycle has often signalled the end of a period of high demand for IT services exports, leading to an economic slowdown.
Sensex, Nifty hit all-time high after early dip; Ola Electric shares up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 188.33 points to 83,267.99, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 46.90 points to 25,465.45
SpiceJet yet to pay Rs 350 crore in TDS, PF of employeesSpiceJet has not paid Rs 220 crore in TDS deductions from employees' salaries between April 2020 and August 2023 to tax authorities.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Centre probes EY India employee's death after mother blames 'work pressure'Centre probes EY employee's death after mother blames 'work pressure'

BJP Haryana manifesto: Jobs for ex-Agniveers, MSP promise, cash benefit for womenAs per the poll manifesto, the BJP stated that 10 industrial cities will be built on the lines of IMT Kharkhoda and special incentives to entrepreneurs to provide jobs to locals.

Salman Khan's father Salim Khan gets fresh threat: SourcesMumbai Police has launched a probe after Bollywood actor Salman Khan's father, Salim Khan, received a fresh threat when he was out for a morning walk on Thursday.
Your refrigerator can give you a UTIA study suggests that contaminated meat may contribute to UTIs and also talks about a possible connection between the rise in infections and antibiotic resistance.

Supreme Court dismisses telecom firms plea on adjusted gross revenueVodafone India, Bharti Airtel, and other telecom firms have filed a curative petition challenging the court's October 2019 verdict, which mandated that they pay the government Rs 92,000 crore within three months.

21 houses of Dalits set on fire in Bihar, Congress's jungle raj jab at NDAInitially, it was reported that over 80 houses were gutted in the incident on Wednesday night, but Bihar police have put the number at 21.

Pak minister on Article 370 restoration: On same page with Congress alliancePakistani defence minister Khawaja Asif said there was a 'high chance' that the Congress-National Conference alliance would come to power in Jammu and Kashmir.

Employee fired for blaming rats for caving-in of portion of Delhi-Mumbai highwayThe firm stated that the comment was made by a junior employee who had no technical understanding regarding the project and confirmed that he had been terminated from the company.

Explained: What US Fed's 50 bps rate cut means for Indian economyThe Fed's decision signalled a shift towards easing monetary policy, with experts divided on its implications for the global economy, including India. Here's a detailed look at how the bigger-than-expected rate cut could impact the Indian economy and the broader market.

Decide on 'Emergency' release in a week: Bombay High Court to film bodyOn September 4, the Bombay High Court had passed an order, directing the CBFC to consider the representations filed by a Sikh body against the film and take a decision by September 18, on whether to release it or not.

PM Modi addresses rally in Srinagar, BJP releases Haryana manifestoAssembly Elections 2024 Live Updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will address two election rallies today in Jammu and Kashmir, seeking votes for BJP candidates. In the first leg of his campaign trail, PM Modi will address a rally in Srinagar's Sher-e-Kashmir stadium and then he will travel to Kathua to address another rally in support of the BJP candidates. Meanwhile, in Haryana, BJP chief JP Nadda will address a rally in Rohtak and release the party's manifesto, titled Sankalp Patra. The first phase of polling in Jammu and Kashmir was completed on Wednesday, September 18, with a voter turnout of more than 61 per cent. Stay tuned to India Today for all the latest updates on two Assembly polls.

Fired from job, Chennai techie worked as Swiggy delivery agent. His story is viralA techie from Chennai who was fired from his job a few months ago was forced to join Swiggy as a delivery partner. He recounted his journey in a LinkedIn post that has now gone viral.

Who is Hasan Mahmud? Young Bangladesh pacer torments India in Chennai TestBangladesh seamer Hasan Mahmud ran through the Indian batting order on Day 1 of the first Test against Bangladesh at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai.

Hezbollah walkie-talkie blasts kill 20, raise fears of wider Israel conflict Live UpdatesWednesday's walkie-talkie blasts came as Israeli Defence Minister Yoav Gallant announced a "new phase in the war" against the Hamas militant group, adding that the "centre of gravity" is moving north with the deployment of a new military division.

JP Nadda's 'failed product' barb at Rahul Gandhi in letter to Mallikarjun KhargeJP Nadda's letter to Mallikarjun Kharge came two days after the latter wrote to the Prime Minister raising concerns over "extremely objectionable, violent and rude" remarks made by NDA leaders against Rahul Gandhi.
How India is preparing for a manned moon mission 16 years from nowChandrayaan-4, slated for launch in 2027, will be a critical stepping stone in India's lunar exploration program.

Japanese firm says walkie talkies in Lebanon blasts were discontinued in 2014The device in question, which requires batteries that were discontinued nearly a decade ago, has also been out of production since 2014, according to Icom. Additionally, the batteries used for the devices have also been discontinued.
What the hell does Covid mean? It's China virus, I like to be accurate: TrumpRepublican nominee Donald Trump called Covid-19, the China virus, while he was addressing a gathering in Michigan.

Telugu choreographer Jani Master charged with POCSO in sexual abuse caseA case has been filed against Telugu choreographer Shaik Jani Basha under the POCSO act by the Narsingi police in Hyderabad, following a sexual abuse complaint by a 21-year-old.

Priyanka Chopra back as Nadia for Citadel 2, shares BTS video from setsPriyanka Chopra has commenced filming for the highly anticipated second season of Citadel. She shared a tour video on Instagram, showcasing her return to the role of Nadia.

Atishi to take oath as Delhi Chief Minister on Saturday: AAPAccording to sources in the Aam Aadmi Party, initially, it was planned that only Atishi would take oath as Delhi Chief Minister. But, later the party decided that her council of ministers would also take the oath with her.

Trudeau uses 'bad actors' grounds to further cut international study permitsIn its announcement on Wednesday, the Canadian government also said that it would also tighten rules for foreign worker rules in an effort to reduce the number of temporary residents in the country.

Chandrababu Naidu claims animal fat used in Tirupati laddoo, YSR Congress deniesSpeaking at the NDA legislature party meeting, N Chandrababu Naidu said that Tirupati laddoo was made with substandard ingredients and animal fat was used instead of ghee during its preparation during YSR Congress's government.

The Buckingham Murders box office day 6: Kareena film struggles to mint moneyBollywood star Kareena Kapoor's murder mystery, The Buckingham Murders, is struggling to make money at the ticket counter. The film has been directed by Hansal Mehta.

Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 vs Singham Again: Director Anees Bazmee says 'thrilled' for bothBhool Bhulaiyaa 3 director Anees Bazmee clarified on Instagram that he is looking forward to the box office clash between his film and Rohit Shetty's Singham Again. Both films are scheduled to release during Diwali.

Suriya's Kanguva gets new release date, to hit theatres on November 14Suriya's highly-anticipated film Kanguva will now release in theatres on November 14. Earlier, it was supposed release alongside Rajinikanth's Vettaiyan on October 10.

The Buckingham Murders director Hansal Mehta: Ekta Kapoor is a misunderstood girlDirector Hansal Mehta and producer Ekta Kapoor collaborated for the first time on The Buckingham Murders, despite Kapoor's reputation for interference, which Mehta did not experience.

sports.headline: Parthiv Patel reveals reasoning behind sending Rishabh Pant ahead of KL RahulFormer India cricketer Parthiv Patel gave the reasoning behind team management's decision to send Rishabh Pant ahead of KL Rahul on Day 1 of the first Test against Bangladesh in Chennai.

Shubman Gill was unlucky: Parthiv Patel defends India batter after Chennai duckParthiv Patel has defended Shubman Gill after the Indian batter was dismissed for a duck on day one of the first Test against Bangladesh on Thursday, September 19.

Cricket Australia bans Victorian women's coach Dulip Samaraweera for 20 yearsCricket Australia has banned Dulip Samaraweera, former head coach of the Victorian women's cricket team, for 20 years following an investigation into a coercive relationship with a female player. The decision underscores CA's commitment to player welfare and integrity.

IND vs BAN: Shubman Gill joins Virat Kohli in unwanted ducks list for IndiaShubman Gill joined Virat Kohli in an unwanted ducks list for India as he suffered a failure during day one of the Chennai Test. Gill was dismissed for an 8-ball duck as Hasan Mahmud wreaked havoc on day one.

IND vs BAN: Virat Kohli fails on India Test return, out for 6 in ChennaiIndia vs Bangladesh, Chennai Test: Virat Kohli's return to the India Test side is off to the worst possible start as he was dismissed for just 6 runs in the first innings of the Chennai Test.

IND vs BAN: Rohit Sharma, Shubman Gill fail in testing conditions in ChennaiIndia captain Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill were dismissed cheaply on Day 1 of the first Test against Bangladesh after Bangladesh captain Najmul Hossain Shanto won the toss and elected to bowl first.

IND vs BAN: Bangladesh end 42-year toss run in Chennai by fielding firstBangladesh's decision to field first in the Chennai Test ended a 42-year toss run at the Chepauk. This is the first time in 21 Tests that a team has decided to field first after winning the toss at the iconic stadium.

Bangladesh not underdogs: Ashwin reckons Chennai pitch perfect for Test cricketIndia vs Bangladesh: Ace spinner R Ashwin reckons that Bangladesh cannot be considered underdogs after their historic series win in Pakistan. Ashwin also shared his memories of playing Test cricket in his hometown, Chennai.

IND vs BAN: India pick 3 pacers for Chennai Test, Akash Deep in XIIndia have picked three fast bowlers for the first Test against Bangladesh in Chennai as Akash Deep joins Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj in the playing XI. Bangladesh captain Najmul Hossain Shanto won the toss and elected to bowl first.

India gleam with hope as Rishabh Pant returns to Tests after absence of 632 daysIndia vs Bangladesh: Rishabh Pant returns to Test cricket after a long gap of 632 days. Pant's return to the Test side not only brings incredible joy to India fans but also adds the much-needed X factor to the Test team.

OTD in 2007: Yuvraj Singh thrashes Stuart Broad for six sixes in an overStar India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh hit England's Stuart Broad for six consecutive sixes in an over during the T20 World Cup 2007 at Kingsmead Durban.

Coco Gauff parts ways with coach Brad Gilbert after early US Open exitCoco Gauff has parted ways with her coach Brad Gilbert following her early exit from the US Open 2024 following a loss against Emma Navarro.

PSG beat Girona, Manchester City-Inter play out stalemateChampions League: Paris Saint-Germain secured a 1-0 victory over Girona with a last-minute goal. Manchester City and Inter Milan played to a goalless draw in their rematch of the 2023 final.

Misfiring Mohun Bagan held to 0-0 draw by FC Ravshan in ACL-II openerMohun Bagan's AFC Champions League Two campaign began on a frustrating note as they played out a goalless draw against Tajikistan's FC Ravshan. Fans' anger with the coach grew as Bagan failed to score goals at home.

What is Rohit Sharma's legacy as Test captain and opener?India's upcoming Test cricket schedule will be a defining period for Rohit Sharma as captain. With 10 Tests in 16 weeks, including a crucial series in Australia, this phase could shape his legacy and India's World Test Championship journey.

AFG vs SA: Farooqi, Ghazanfar hand hosts historic ODI win against Proteas17-year-old Allah Ghazanfar and left-arm pacer Falazhaq Farroqi ran through the South Africa batting attack on Wednesday, September 18. The fast bowlers first bowled out SA for their 5th lowest ODI total and then held their nerve to clinch a historic ODI win in Sharjah.

Ansu returns from injury in time for Barcelona's Champions League openerAnsu Fati has returned to Barcelona's squad for their UEFA Champions League clash against AS Monaco after recovering from injury. The 21-year-old forward now has another chance to prove his worth under manager Hansi Flick.

Bayern Munich boss Vincent Kompany shuts doubters after UCL win: We keep goingVincent Kompany silenced his critics as Bayern Munich delivered a dominant 9-2 victory over Dinamo Zagreb in the UEFA Champions League, showcasing his tactical brilliance and proving his doubters wrong after a challenging start to his managerial journey.

Keep it simple and have fun: Harry Brook's simple mantra on captaincy debutEngland stand-in ODI captain Harry Book aims to keep things simple and have some fun in the series against Australia. Brook was named captain after Jos Buttler injured his calf.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
